text: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><oai:record xmlns:dri="http://www.driver-repository.eu/namespace/dri" xmlns="http://namespace.openaire.eu/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:oai="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:dr="http://www.driver-repository.eu/namespace/dr" xmlns:oaf="http://namespace.openaire.eu/oaf" xmlns:prov="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance"><oai:header><dri:objIdentifier>webcrawl____::000015093c397516c0b1b000f38982de</dri:objIdentifier><dri:recordIdentifier>WOS:000319032000005</dri:recordIdentifier><dri:dateOfCollection>2016-01-26T08:36:52.269Z</dri:dateOfCollection><dri:repositoryId>34b44c0f-e13a-412b-8fca-4f3858455fca_UmVwb3NpdG9yeVNlcnZpY2VSZXNvdXJjZXMvUmVwb3NpdG9yeVNlcnZpY2VSZXNvdXJjZVR5cGU=</dri:repositoryId><oaf:datasourceprefix>webcrawl____</oaf:datasourceprefix></oai:header><oai:metadata><csvRecord xmlns=""><column name="OA">N</column><column name="PT">J</column><column name="AU">Mariotti, S; Sargentini, V; Pardini, M; Giannoni, F; De Spirito, M; Gagliardi, MC; Greco, E; Teloni, R; Fraziano, M; Nisini, R</column><column name="BA"/><column name="BE"/><column name="GP"/><column name="AF">Mariotti, Sabrina; Sargentini, Valeria; Pardini, Manuela; Giannoni, Federico; De Spirito, Marco; Gagliardi, Maria Cristina; Greco, Emanuela; Teloni, Raffaela; Fraziano, Maurizio; Nisini, Roberto</column><column name="BF"/><column name="CA"/><column name="TI">Mycobacterium tuberculosis may escape helper T cell recognition by infecting human fibroblasts</column><column name="SO">HUMAN IMMUNOLOGY</column><column name="SE"/><column name="BS"/><column name="LA">English</column><column name="DT">Article</column><column name="CT"/><column name="CY"/><column name="CL"/><column name="SP"/><column name="HO"/><column name="DE"/><column name="ID">ALVEOLAR EPITHELIAL-CELLS; DENDRITIC CELLS; ANTIGEN PRESENTATION; 19-KDA LIPOPROTEIN; ENDOTHELIAL-CELLS; TUBERCLE BACILLI; HELA CELLS; BOVIS BCG; EXPRESSION; INHIBITION</column><column name="AB">The host immune response can limit Mycobacterium tuberculosis (Mtb) spreading in primary tuberculosis (TB) without eradicating all bacilli, which can persist causing latent TB infection and are responsible for reactivation TB. Persistent Mtb is confined to granulomas within phagocytes, but it is also found in other non-immune cells. We focused on fibroblasts since these cells participate to the granuloma formation and were shown to be infected in latent TB infections. We show that in vitro both Mtb and Bacille Calmette-Guerin actively replicate in human fibroblasts. Mycobacterial infection of fibroblasts causes a significant inhibition of interferon (IFN)-gamma induced membrane expression of major histocompatibility complex class II molecules in these cells. The functional consequence of in vitro infection is a significant reduction of the fibroblast capacity to present peptides and soluble proteins to autologous specific CD4(+) T cell clones. Moreover, fibroblasts are capable of presenting antigen derived from the processing of heat-killed Mtb, but not from viable Mtb. Data indicate that IFN-gamma treated fibroblasts are capable of presenting antigens derived from the processing of whole bacteria in addition to the capacity to present peptides and isolated proteins. Interestingly, Mtb infected fibroblasts lose this capacity, suggesting that Mtb may evade T helper immune surveillance by infecting fibroblasts. (c) 2013 American Society for Histocompatibility and Immunogenetics. Published by Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.</column><column name="C1">[Mariotti, Sabrina; Sargentini, Valeria; Pardini, Manuela; Giannoni, Federico; Gagliardi, Maria Cristina; Teloni, Raffaela; Nisini, Roberto] Ist Super Sanita, Dipartimento Malattie Infett Parassitarie & Immun, I-00161 Rome, Italy; [De Spirito, Marco] Univ Cattolica Sacro Cuore, Ist Fis, Rome, Italy; [Greco, Emanuela; Fraziano, Maurizio] Univ Roma Tor Vergata, Dipartimento Biol, I-00173 Rome, Italy</column><column name="RP">Nisini, R (reprint author), Ist Super Sanita, Dipartimento Malattie Infett Parassitarie & Immun, Viale Regina Elena 299, I-00161 Rome, Italy.</column><column name="EM">roberto.nisini@iss.it</column><column name="RI">Fraziano, Maurizio/F-1425-2013</column><column name="OI">Fraziano, Maurizio/0000-0002-5643-0769</column><column name="FU">"7th EC Framework Programme Project ""NEWTBVac"" [241745]"</column><column name="FX">"This work was partially supported by the 7th EC Framework Programme Project ""NEWTBVac"" Grant #241745."</column><column name="CR"/><column name="NR">39</column><column name="TC">0</column><column name="Z9">1</column><column name="PU">ELSEVIER SCIENCE INC</column><column name="PI">NEW YORK</column><column name="PA">360 PARK AVE SOUTH, NEW YORK, NY 10010-1710 USA</column><column name="SN">0198-8859</column><column name="EI">1879-1166</column><column name="BN"/><column name="J9">HUM IMMUNOL</column><column name="JI">Hum. Immunol.</column><column name="PD">JUN</column><column name="PY">2013</column><column name="VL">74</column><column name="IS">6</column><column name="PN"/><column name="SU"/><column name="SI"/><column name="MA"/><column name="BP">722</column><column name="EP">729</column><column name="AR"/><column name="DI">10.1016/j.humimm.2013.02.005</column><column name="D2"/><column name="PG">8</column><column name="WC">Immunology</column><column name="SC">Immunology</column><column name="GA">145QN</column><column isID="true" name="UT">WOS:000319032000005</column></csvRecord></oai:metadata><about><provenance xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance.xsd"><originDescription harvestDate="2016-01-26T08:36:52.269Z" altered="true"><baseURL>file:///var/lib/dnet/data/wos/metadata.tsv</baseURL><identifier/><datestamp/><metadataNamespace/></originDescription></provenance><oaf:datainfo><oaf:inferred>false</oaf:inferred><oaf:deletedbyinference>false</oaf:deletedbyinference><oaf:trust>0.9</oaf:trust><oaf:inferenceprovenance/><oaf:provenanceaction schemename="dnet:provenanceActions" schemeid="dnet:provenanceActions" classname="sysimport:crosswalk:repository" classid="sysimport:crosswalk:repository"/></oaf:datainfo></about></oai:record>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><oai:record xmlns:dri="http://www.driver-repository.eu/namespace/dri" xmlns="http://namespace.openaire.eu/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:oai="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:dr="http://www.driver-repository.eu/namespace/dr" xmlns:oaf="http://namespace.openaire.eu/oaf" xmlns:prov="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance"><oai:header><dri:objIdentifier>webcrawl____::000038b2e009d799643ba2b05a155877</dri:objIdentifier><dri:recordIdentifier>WOS:000305085000038</dri:recordIdentifier><dri:dateOfCollection>2016-01-26T08:35:33.562Z</dri:dateOfCollection><dri:repositoryId>34b44c0f-e13a-412b-8fca-4f3858455fca_UmVwb3NpdG9yeVNlcnZpY2VSZXNvdXJjZXMvUmVwb3NpdG9yeVNlcnZpY2VSZXNvdXJjZVR5cGU=</dri:repositoryId><oaf:datasourceprefix>webcrawl____</oaf:datasourceprefix></oai:header><oai:metadata><csvRecord xmlns=""><column name="OA">N</column><column name="PT">J</column><column name="AU">Chremmos, ID; Efremidis, NK</column><column name="BA"/><column name="BE"/><column name="GP"/><column name="AF">Chremmos, I. D.; Efremidis, N. K.</column><column name="BF"/><column name="CA"/><column name="TI">Surface optical Bloch oscillations in semi-infinite waveguide arrays</column><column name="SO">OPTICS LETTERS</column><column name="SE"/><column name="BS"/><column name="LA">English</column><column name="DT">Article</column><column name="CT"/><column name="CY"/><column name="CL"/><column name="SP"/><column name="HO"/><column name="DE"/><column name="ID">SEMICONDUCTOR SUPERLATTICE; ELECTRONS</column><column name="AB">We predict that surface optical Bloch oscillations can exist in semi-infinite waveguide arrays with a linear index variation, if the array parameters close to the boundary are appropriately perturbed. The perturbation is such that the surface states obtain the Wannier-Stark ladder eigenvalues of the unperturbed infinite array. The number of waveguides, whose parameters need to be controlled, decreases with increasing ratio of index gradient over coupling. The configuration can find applications as a '' matched '' termination of waveguide arrays to eliminate the distortion of Bloch oscillations due to reflection on the boundaries. (C) 2012 Optical Society of America</column><column name="C1">[Chremmos, I. D.; Efremidis, N. K.] Univ Crete, Dept Appl Math, Iraklion 71409, Crete, Greece</column><column name="RP">Chremmos, ID (reprint author), Univ Crete, Dept Appl Math, Iraklion 71409, Crete, Greece.</column><column name="EM">jochremm@central.ntua.gr</column><column name="RI">Efremidis, Nikolaos/E-1991-2011</column><column name="OI">Efremidis, Nikolaos/0000-0002-9830-0268</column><column name="FU">Archimedes Center for Modeling, Analysis and Computation (ACMAC) [FP7-REGPOT-2009-1]</column><column name="FX">This work was supported by the Archimedes Center for Modeling, Analysis and Computation (ACMAC) (project FP7-REGPOT-2009-1).</column><column name="CR"/><column name="NR">14</column><column name="TC">2</column><column name="Z9">2</column><column name="PU">OPTICAL SOC AMER</column><column name="PI">WASHINGTON</column><column name="PA">2010 MASSACHUSETTS AVE NW, WASHINGTON, DC 20036 USA</column><column name="SN">0146-9592</column><column name="EI"/><column name="BN"/><column name="J9">OPT LETT</column><column name="JI">Opt. Lett.</column><column name="PD">JUN 1</column><column name="PY">2012</column><column name="VL">37</column><column name="IS">11</column><column name="PN"/><column name="SU"/><column name="SI"/><column name="MA"/><column name="BP">1892</column><column name="EP">1894</column><column name="AR"/><column name="DI"/><column name="D2"/><column name="PG">3</column><column name="WC">Optics</column><column name="SC">Optics</column><column name="GA">956JD</column><column isID="true" name="UT">WOS:000305085000038</column></csvRecord></oai:metadata><about><provenance xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance.xsd"><originDescription harvestDate="2016-01-26T08:35:33.562Z" altered="true"><baseURL>file:///var/lib/dnet/data/wos/metadata.tsv</baseURL><identifier/><datestamp/><metadataNamespace/></originDescription></provenance><oaf:datainfo><oaf:inferred>false</oaf:inferred><oaf:deletedbyinference>false</oaf:deletedbyinference><oaf:trust>0.9</oaf:trust><oaf:inferenceprovenance/><oaf:provenanceaction schemename="dnet:provenanceActions" schemeid="dnet:provenanceActions" classname="sysimport:crosswalk:repository" classid="sysimport:crosswalk:repository"/></oaf:datainfo></about></oai:record>

D.; Efremidis, N. K.</column><column name="BF"/><column name="CA"/><column name="TI">Surface optical Bloch oscillations in semi-infinite waveguide arrays</column><column name="SO">OPTICS LETTERS</column><column name="SE"/><column name="BS"/><column name="LA">English</column><column name="DT">Article</column><column name="CT"/><column name="CY"/><column name="CL"/><column name="SP"/><column name="HO"/><column name="DE"/><column name="ID">SEMICONDUCTOR SUPERLATTICE; ELECTRONS</column><column name="AB">We predict that surface optical Bloch oscillations can exist in semi-infinite waveguide arrays with a linear index variation, if the array parameters close to the boundary are appropriately perturbed. The perturbation is such that the surface states obtain the Wannier-Stark ladder eigenvalues of the unperturbed infinite array. The number of waveguides, whose parameters need to be controlled, decreases with increasing ratio of index gradient over coupling. The configuration can find applications as a '' matched '' termination of waveguide arrays to eliminate the distortion of Bloch oscillations due to reflection on the boundaries. (C) 2012 Optical Society of America</column><column name="C1">[Chremmos, I. D.; Efremidis, N. Lett.</column><column name="PD">JUN 1</column><column name="PY">2012</column><column name="VL">37</column><column name="IS">11</column><column name="PN"/><column name="SU"/><column name="SI"/><column name="MA"/><column name="BP">1892</column><column name="EP">1894</column><column name="AR"/><column name="DI"/><column name="D2"/><column name="PG">3</column><column name="WC">Optics</column><column name="SC">Optics</column><column name="GA">956JD</column><column isID="true" name="UT">WOS:000305085000038</column></csvRecord></oai:metadata><about><provenance xmlns="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance.xsd"><originDescription harvestDate="2016-01-26T08:35:33.562Z" altered="true"><baseURL>file:///var/lib/dnet/data/wos/metadata.tsv</baseURL><identifier/><datestamp/><metadataNamespace/></originDescription></provenance><oaf:datainfo><oaf:inferred>false</oaf:inferred><oaf:deletedbyinference>false</oaf:deletedbyinference><oaf:trust>0.9</oaf:trust><oaf:inferenceprovenance/><oaf:provenanceaction schemename="dnet:provenanceActions" schemeid="dnet:provenanceActions" classname="sysimport:crosswalk:repository" classid="sysimport:crosswalk:repository"/></oaf:datainfo></about></oai:record>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><oai:record xmlns:dri="http://www.driver-repository.eu/namespace/dri" xmlns="http://namespace.openaire.eu/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:oai="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/" xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:dr="http://www.driver-repository.eu/namespace/dr" xmlns:oaf="http://namespace.openaire.eu/oaf" xmlns:prov="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/provenance"><oai:header><dri:objIdentifier>webcrawl____::000072558c91b1e273be0565df95f613</dri:objIdentifier><dri:recordIdentifier>WOS:000266501800010</dri:recordIdentifier><dri:dateOfCollection>2016-01-26T08:35:00.984Z</dri:dateOfCollection><dri:repositoryId>34b44c0f-e13a-412b-8fca-4f3858455fca_UmVwb3NpdG9yeVNlcnZpY2VSZXNvdXJjZXMvUmVwb3NpdG9yeVNlcnZpY2VSZXNvdXJjZVR5cGU=</dri:repositoryId><oaf:datasourceprefix>webcrawl____</oaf:datasourceprefix></oai:header><oai:metadata><csvRecord xmlns=""><column name="OA">N</column><column name="PT">J</column><column name="AU">Bazzocchi, F; Varzielas, ID</column><column name="BA"/><column name="BE"/><column name="GP"/><column name="AF">Bazzocchi, Federica; Varzielas, Ivo de Medeiros</column><column name="BF"/><column name="CA"/><column name="TI">Tribimaximal mixing in a viable family symmetry unified model with an extended seesaw mechanism</column><column name="SO">PHYSICAL REVIEW D</column><column name="SE"/><column name="BS"/><column name="LA">English</column><column name="DT">Article</column><column name="CT"/><column name="CY"/><column name="CL"/><column name="SP"/><column name="HO"/><column name="DE"/><column name="ID">HANDED NEUTRINO DOMINANCE; CP VIOLATION; SOLAR NEUTRINOS; SO(10); MASS; BREAKING; OSCILLATIONS</column><column name="AB">We present a grand unified model based on SO(10) with a Delta(27) family symmetry. Fermion masses and mixings are fitted and agree well with experimental values. An extended seesaw mechanism plays a key role in the generation of the leptonic mixing, which is approximately tribimaximal.</column><column name="C1">[Bazzocchi, Federica] Vrije Univ Amsterdam, Dept Phys Astron, NL-1081 HV Amsterdam, Netherlands; [Varzielas, Ivo de Medeiros] Inst Super Tecn, Dept Fis, CFTP, P-1049001 Lisbon, Portugal</column><column name="RP">Bazzocchi, F (reprint author), Vrije Univ Amsterdam, Dept Phys Astron, NL-1081 HV Amsterdam, Netherlands.</column><column name="EM"/><column name="RI"/><column name="OI"/><column name="FU">MEC-Valencia MEC [FPA2008-00319/FPA]; European Commission [MRTN-CT-2004503369, ILIAS/N6RII3-CT-2004-506222]; foundation for Fundamental Research of Matter (FOM); National Organization for Scientific Research (NWO); FCT [SFRH/BPD/35919/2007, POCI/81919/2007, CERN/FP/83503/2008, CFTP-FCT UNIT 777]; POCTI (FEDER); Marie Curie [RTN MRTN-CT2006-035505]</column><column name="CR"/><column name="NR">41</column><column name="TC">16</column><column name="Z9">16</column><column name="PU">AMER PHYSICAL SOC</column><column name="PI">COLLEGE PK</column><column name="PA">ONE PHYSICS ELLIPSE, COLLEGE PK, MD 20740-3844 USA</column><column name="SN">1550-7998</column><column name="EI"/><column name="BN"/><column name="J9">PHYS REV D</column><column name="JI">Phys. Rev.
